name: wittingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves knowing or planning what you are doing: Wittingly or unwittingly, they abetted the crime. Did the CIA cooperate wittingly in illegal activities? Opposite
unwittingly formalSee
witting
More examplesFewer examplesStolen goods are often bought unwittingly or wittingly by collectors.If the bank wittingly or unwittingly laundered funds, we should recover them if we can. The prosecution claimed she had wittingly and willingly taken part in the bombing of a bio-technology institute.
